jx.jx_en_mean: neither parallel nor at right angles to a specified or implied line; askew

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb in the sense 'move obliquely'): shortening of Old Northern French eskiuwer, variant of Old French eschiver 'eschew'. The adjective and noun (early 17th cent.) are from the verb

encyclopedia.content: skew是指时钟偏移，同样的时钟产生的多个子时钟信号之间的延时差异。它表现的形式是多种多样的，既包含了时钟驱动器的多个输出之间的偏移，也包含了由于PCB走线误差造成的接收端和驱动端时钟信号之间的偏移。

entry.tran: 影响…的准确性;歪曲;扭曲
entry.def: If something is skewed, it is changed or affected to some extent by a new or unusual factor, and so is not correct or normal.

example.ex: The arithmetic of nuclear running costs has been skewed by the fall in the cost of other fuels...
example.tran: 核运营成本的计算由于其他燃料的降价而出现了偏差。

example.ex: Today's election will skew the results in favor of the northern end of the county.
example.tran: 今天的选举将使结果有利于这个郡的北部地区。

means.word_mean: 1. having an oblique or slanting direction or position;
